intro: Prosopidastrum gracile, commonly known as the slender prosopidastrum, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae, which includes plants known for their diverse morphological characteristics. The plant typically features slender stems and small, clustered leaves, often with a hairy texture. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in dense inflorescences, and it blooms during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
